My name is Matt Buehler, and welcome to my site! 
I am a graduate student at Auburn University in the Phyletica lab. 
My research interest center around the different aspects of snake evolution. 
Some of the previous work that I have done includes phylogenetics and biogeography of Australasian elapid snakes, phylogeography and species delimitation of sea kraits (genus *Laticauda*), and my current project, population and conservation genomics of Eastern Indigo Snakes *Drymarchon couperi*,
